class src.services.auth.Auth[source]¶

Bases: object

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float = 60) → str[source]¶

Creates a JWT access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to encode into the token.

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – The time in minutes after which the token expires. Defaults to settings.JWT_EXPIRE_MINUTES.

Returns:

The encoded JWT access token.

Return type:

str

async create_email_token(data: dict) → str[source]¶

Creates a JWT email token.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The data to encode into the token.

Returns:

The encoded JWT email token.

Return type:

str

async get_current_admin(user: dict = Depends(get_current_user)) → dict[source]¶

Checks if the current user is an admin.

Parameters:

user – The current user as a dictionary.

Returns:

The current user if they are an admin.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user is not an admin.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → dict[source]¶

Gets the current authenticated user by verifying the JWT access token.

Parameters:

  • token (str, optional) – The JWT access token to verify. Defaults to Depends(oauth2_scheme).

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session to use. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

The current authenticated user if the token is valid, or raises

an HTTPException with a 401 status code otherwise.

Return type:

dict

async get_email_from_token(token: str) → str[source]¶

Gets the email address associated with a JWT email token.

Parameters:

token (str) – The JWT email token to verify.

Returns:

The email address associated with the token if it is valid, or raises

an HTTPException with a 401 status code for an invalid scope or a 422 status code for an invalid token otherwise.

Return type:

str

get_password_hash(password: str) → str[source]¶

Gets the hashed version of a given password.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain password to hash.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
async request_password_reset(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None[source]¶

Initiates a password reset request by generating a reset token and sending a reset email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user requesting the password reset.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session to use for retrieving the user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user is not found in the database.

Side Effects:

Stores a reset token with a 1-hour expiration in the cache and sends a password reset email to the user.

async reset_password(token: str, new_password: str, db: AsyncSession) → None[source]¶

Resets the user’s password using a reset token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The reset token that was sent to the user’s email.

  • new_password (str) – The new password to set for the user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session to use for updating the user’s password.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or expired, if the token does not match the cached email, or if the user is not found in the database.

Side Effects:

Updates the user’s password in the database and deletes the reset token from the cache.

verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool[source]¶

Verifies a plain password against a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain password to verify.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to verify against.

Returns:

True if the password is valid, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

class src.services.cloudinary_config.UploadFileService(cloud_name, api_key, api_secret)[source]¶

Bases: object

upload_file(file: UploadFile, username: str) → str[source]¶

Uploads a file to Cloudinary and returns the URL of the uploaded image.

The image is uploaded with a public ID in the format “RestApp/<username>”. If an image with this public ID already exists, it is overwritten. The image is resized to 250x250px and cropped to fill the dimensions.

Parameters:

  • file – The file to upload.

  • username – The username of the user to associate with the image.

Returns:

The URL of the uploaded image.

Raises:

Exception – If the upload fails.

async src.services.email.send_reset_email(email: str, token: str, BASE_URL: str)[source]¶

Sends a password reset email to the given email address with a link to reset the password.

Parameters:

  • email – The email address to send the password reset email to.

  • token – The JWT token to include in the password reset link.

  • BASE_URL – The base URL of the API to include in the password reset link.

Raises:

  • ConnectionErrors – If there is an error connecting to the SMTP server.

  • Exception – If there is an unexpected error sending the email.

async src.services.email.send_verification_email(email: str, token: str, BASE_URL: str)[source]¶

Sends a verification email to the given email address with a link to verify the email address.

Parameters:

  • email – The email address to send the verification email to.

  • token – The JWT token to include in the verification link.

  • BASE_URL – The base URL of the API to include in the verification link.

Raises:

  • ConnectionErrors – If there is an error connecting to the SMTP server.

  • Exception – If there is an unexpected error sending the email.
